metadata.title: Earthquake Brace+Bolt (EBB) Retrofit Program
related_sources: CEBC Appendix Chapter A3 (Prescriptive Cripple Wall Bracing)

program_overview.name: Earthquake Brace+Bolt (EBB)
program_overview.description: Incentive-based seismic retrofit program for older wood-frame houses with cripple wall foundations. Provides up to $3,000 reimbursement for qualifying retrofits.

target_buildings.foundation_type: Cripple wall (short stud wall between foundation and first floor)

conditions: Must be in an eligible ZIP code (published annually by CRMP)
Must complete work within program timeline
Must use a registered EBB contractor or be registered as owner-builder
Must follow CEBC Appendix A3 prescriptive design OR engineered design

permit_pathway.review_type_note: Prescriptive CEBC A3 retrofits are eligible for OTC review at DBI counter. Engineered designs may require in-house review.
permit_pathway.permit_fee: Per Table 1A-A based on construction valuation (typically $5,000-$15,000 range)
permit_pathway.licensing_note: Per G-01 Status I, prescriptive EBB retrofits do NOT require a licensed architect or engineer — plans may be prepared by the homeowner, contractor, or unlicensed designer. However, engineered designs require a CA-licensed civil or structural engineer.

required_elements.details: Show property lines, building footprint, setbacks, and north arrow
Show all foundation walls with dimensions. Identify existing cripple walls to be braced. Show location and extent of new plywood sheathing, anchor bolts, and foundation plate connectors.
Show each cripple wall with dimensions — height, length, openings. Show plywood sheathing extent, nailing pattern, framing connectors, and ventilation openings to remain.
Show type (expansion or adhesive), size (typically 1/2" or 5/8"), spacing, edge distance, and embedment depth per CEBC A3
Show connector type (UFP10, A35, or equivalent), spacing, and fastener schedule per CEBC A3 Table A3-2
Show panel thickness (minimum 15/32" Structural I), nailing pattern (4" edges / 12" field minimum per CEBC A3), and blocking at panel edges
Show braced wall percentage per CEBC A3 Table A3-1 — typically 80% of each cripple wall line must be sheathed
Recommended: photos of existing cripple walls, foundation, and mudsill condition

cebc_a3_reference.table_a3_1: Minimum bracing requirements — percent of cripple wall to be sheathed based on building weight and wall height
cebc_a3_reference.table_a3_2: Foundation sill plate connector schedule — type, spacing, and fasteners
cebc_a3_reference.table_a3_3: Anchor bolt requirements — size, spacing, edge distance by wall height

standard_ebb_retrofit_includes: Install anchor bolts connecting mudsill to concrete foundation (expansion or adhesive)
Install foundation plate connectors (UFP10, A35, or equivalent) connecting cripple wall studs to mudsill
Install structural plywood sheathing on cripple walls (Structural I, 15/32" minimum)
Install blocking between cripple wall studs at plywood panel edges
Nailing per CEBC A3 schedule (typically 8d nails at 4" o.c. edges, 12" o.c. field)
Maintain or replace ventilation openings per IRC requirements
common_additions: Water heater strapping (required by code, often done simultaneously)
Cripple wall stud replacement (if existing studs are damaged or inadequate)
Mudsill replacement (if existing mudsill is deteriorated)
Garage opening strengthening (if cripple wall contains garage door opening)
out_of_scope: Foundation replacement or underpinning (requires engineered design + in-house review)
Structural work above first floor (requires licensed engineer)
Chimney bracing (separate scope, may be combined)
Soft-story retrofit per AB-094/106 (different program, multi-unit buildings)

inspections.timing: After anchor bolts installed, before covering
what_inspector_checks: Bolt type and size per plan

inspections.timing: After plywood and connectors installed, before covering

soft_story_program.distinction: Soft-story program targets multi-unit buildings (5+ units typically) with weak ground floors. EBB targets 1-4 unit wood-frame with cripple walls. Different scope, different requirements.
soft_story_program.overlap: Some single-family homes may be in soft-story program zones but qualify for EBB instead if they have cripple walls ≤4ft

urm_retrofit.distinction: URM program targets brick/stone buildings. EBB is wood-frame only.

ab_108.purpose: Referenced in S-09 — administrative bulletin providing additional DBI guidance for EBB retrofits in San Francisco

factors_affecting_cost: Linear feet of cripple wall to brace
Condition of existing mudsill and foundation
Whether additional work is needed (stud replacement, mudsill repair)
cost_estimates.permit_fee_estimate: $200-$500 typically (based on construction valuation via Table 1A-A)

common_issues.issue: Plans don't show wall percentage calculations per CEBC A3 Table A3-1
common_issues.fix: Add calculation showing total cripple wall length, braced length, and percentage for each wall line

common_issues.issue: Anchor bolt spacing or edge distance doesn't meet CEBC A3
common_issues.fix: Verify anchor bolt schedule against CEBC A3 Table A3-3. Minimum edge distance is typically 1-3/4" for 1/2" bolts

common_issues.issue: Nailing pattern not specified or inadequate
common_issues.fix: Specify 8d nails at 4" o.c. at panel edges and 12" o.c. at intermediate supports per CEBC A3

common_issues.issue: Ventilation openings blocked by new plywood
common_issues.fix: Show ventilation openings on plan — IRC requires 1 sqft per 150 sqft of crawl space. Cut plywood around vents or provide alternate ventilation.

common_issues.issue: Existing mudsill deteriorated — plans don't address
common_issues.fix: If mudsill is damaged, plan must show replacement method. Pressure-treated lumber required for replacement mudsill.

tool_integration.review_path: OTC with plans (prescriptive CEBC A3) or in-house (engineered design)
tool_integration.signature_requirement: G-01 Status I exempt (prescriptive) or Status III (engineered)
tool_integration.fee_calculation: Table 1A-A alterations category based on construction valuation
